{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is involved in a high-speed motor vehicle collision and presents with severe facial lacerations, respiratory distress, and decreased breath sounds over the left lung base. The x-ray shows a fractured left second rib, depression of the left mainstem bronchus, deviation of the nasogastric tube to the right, and a widened mediastinum. These findings are consistent with traumatic bronchial rupture, which is the most likely diagnosis.", "answer_choice": "B"}
